para.sentence: Luke (1969b, pp. 25 and 35) gives Chebyshev-series expansions for the confluent hypergeometric functions U\left(a,b,x\right) and M\left(a,b,x\right) (§13.2(i)) whose regions of validity include intervals with endpoints x=\infty and x=0 , respectively.

As special cases of these results a Chebyshev-series expansion for U\left(a,x\right) valid when \lambda\leq x<\infty follows from (12.7.14), and Chebyshev-series expansions for U\left(a,x\right) and V\left(a,x\right) valid when 0\leq x\leq\lambda follow from (12.4.1), (12.4.2), (12.7.12), and (12.7.13).
Here \lambda denotes an arbitrary positive constant.
